title: Compiler hanging probably related to impl-trait stuff

labels.name: I-hang
labels.description: Issue: The compiler never terminates, due to infinite loops, deadlock, livelock, etc.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

The compiler seems to hang when I make a small change to my code (from something that compiled quickly before). `cargo check` has no problems. It's not eating up memory. I haven't yet been able to create a MWE, but I thought maybe someone might know what's going on anyway.

https://github.com/davidspies/standing-relations/commit/20d8d27c129c061cf363b490957163ab46aae6de

### Meta
<!--
If you're using the stable version of the compiler, you should also check if the
bug also exists in the beta or nightly versions.
-->

`rustc --version --verbose`:
```
rustc 1.55.0-nightly (149f4836d 2021-06-17)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: 149f4836dd6d9e789a26dca16dc034588866894e
commit-date: 2021-06-17

LLVM version: 12.0.1
```
